item.title: Report X-2025041668
item.description:
Report X-2025041668

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: Clovis - Curry
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TILX 203297 had residue around the BOV cap in the BNSF Clovis, NM yard by an FRA inspector. Upon inspection by the contractor, the valve was determined to be closed. The cap was removed, and some slight residue was found inside the BOV nozzle. The gasket appeared to be old, so a new BOV cap gasket was installed and the cap tool-tightened. The car was cleaned and released.

item.title: Report X-2025041667
item.description:
Report X-2025041667

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: Clovis - Curry
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GATX 90837 was found in the Clovis, NM yard with residue on the car body. The origin of the residue was from the PRV. The car was not overloaded, and the valve was closed, so this release was determined to be caused by rough car handling, causing the PRV to vent. The car was cleaned and released.
